fields.description:
I took a look on wrong translations in Admin section of Issues, Projects, Users mangement, Project settings, but i see that they are now correct. Minor things i have found:

System menu:
English: "Automation" - Polish: "Automatyzacja"
English: "Automation rules" - Polish: "Reguły automatyzacji"

Issue menu:
Issue features -  Now:  "Cechy zgłoszenia".  Should be: "Funkcje zgłoszeń" or  "Inne funkcje zgłoszeń"

 

In workflow condidtions:

Compare Number Custom Field -  Condition to allow transition if a comparison of specified Number Custom Field to a specified value is true.Compare Number Custom Field Condition to allow transition if a comparison of specified Number Custom Field to a specified value is true.

Porównaj warunek pola niestandardowego liczby - Warunek umożliwia przejście, jeśli porównanie określonego pola niestandardowego liczby z określoną wartością jest prawdziwe.

Only Bamboo Notifications Workflow Condition - Only makes this transition available to the Bamboo build notifications. 

Warunek przepływu pracy powiadomień Bamboo - Udostępnia to przejście tylko do powiadomień o kompilacji Bamboo.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The "like" option on the bottom of every Confluence page is made out of several concatenated strings. This works well in English, but not in any other languages.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open any Confluence page localized (e.g. in Dutch, Spanish or Russian)
 # Read the "like option" on the bottom of a page after you've liked the page
 # The string is incorrect because the sentence is incorrect

h3. Expected Results

These strings should not be concatenated. There should be a separate string for a singular case and a plural "like" case. As these verbs for these cases are not the same in other languages besides English. There should be one string for every case. Exactly how other strings in here: [https://stash.atlassian.com/projects/CONFCLOUD/repos/confluence-frontend/browse/packages/confluence-frontend-server/src/i18n/source.json] are written, such as:

"likes.summary.1.promoted" or "likes.summary.you" or "likes.summary.1.promoted"
h3. Actual Results

A mix between plural and singular of incorrect verbs and sentences structures in several languages. 
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: "Like this page" option concatenated

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
 # The page that is shown to a user for the first as soon as they have started a new space only shows localized in certain languages, e.g. in Dutch, but mostly it shows in English, even though the user's settings is set to a different language (tested with Spanish, German and French).
 # The strings are concatenated, meaning all the sentences have been split up over different strings, making it very hard to put these sentences back together in a natural sounding way for a non-english language.

*Sidenote:* 

*all translations exist in Smartling, but are not picked up for some reason*

*File with all keys for this page has been added to this ticket*
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set CC in a localized language, like Spanish
 # Create a new space
 # Check out the welcome page with the intro text

h3. Expected Results

Text should be shown in localized language, as has been set in the user's settings.
h3. Actual Results

It is shown in English (see screenshots)
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: 'Welcome to your new Space' content on CC not shown localized

Hi, we are using Jira Service Desk in italian.

Attached you can see a screenshot of the customer view of the issue. Since we cannot customize/remove the automatic comment created by Jira, this is really a huge bug for our customers that .

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a user add a comment to a page, the notification for affected user is translated wrong

This issue appears on 6.15.9 as well as 7.3.3. There are translation issues with Notifications in German
h3. Steps to Reproduce

The problem lies in two of the sentences display by the system when notifications are sent in Confluence.
"1 Kommentar zu dies Seite"
"testuserlb hat einen dies kommentiert"

Which would roughly translate back to:
"1 comment the this page" (not accurate)
"testuserlb has commented a this"(not accurate)
h3. Expected Results

{color:#172b4d}The correct translation would be:{color}
{color:#172b4d}"1 Kommentar zu dieser Seite" or "1 Kommentar auf dieser Seite"{color}
{color:#172b4d}"testuserlb hat folgendes kommentiert" or "tesuserlb hat folgenden Kommentar hinzugefügt"{color}
h3. Actual Results

The translations are seen as below.

"1 Kommentar zu dies Seite"
"testuserlb hat einen dies kommentiert"

which translates to

"1 comment the this page" (not accurate)
"testuserlb has commented a this"(not accurate)

!Translation_Issue_7_3_3.PNG!
h3. Workaround


 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Incorrect German Translation in notifications

fields.description:
Customers want the German translation of the "Get notifications" / "Don't notify me" buttons in the Service Desk customer portal:

* currently (JSD 4.3.3) those buttons translate "Benachrichtigungen erhalten" (=Get notifications) and "Keine Benachrichtigung"
* this is perceived as misleading; our customer suggests to use
** "Benachrichtigungen aktivieren" (=Get notifications/ "turn on notifications)
** "Benachrichtigungen deaktivieren" (=Stop notifications/ "Don't notify me")

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

French translation for batching email notifications (mentioned)

The sentence "vous avez mentionné dans ce ticket" means (you have mentioned in this ticket), where it should be "vous avez été mentionné dans ce ticket" (you have been mentioned in this ticket)
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Language should be French
 # Enable batching email notifications
 # Mention a user in a sample ticket
 # Sentence "vous avez mentionné dans ce ticket" means (you have mentioned in this ticket)
 # It should be "vous avez été mentionné dans ce ticket" (you have been mentioned in this ticket)

h3. Expected Results

In French, the above-mentioned sentence needs to be corrected to  "vous avez été mentionné dans ce ticket"
h3. Actual Results

!image-2020-10-09-12-38-44-013.png|thumbnail!
  
h3. Workaround

Please try this in a staging environment and then proceed with production
 * Navigate to $Jira-Installation-dir/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/atlassian-bundled-plugins/
 * Look for file 'jira-core-language-pack-fr_FR-8.5.0.v20190920192957.jar'
 * Take a backup of this file 'jira-core-language-pack-fr_FR-8.5.0.v20190920192957.jar'
 * Download the file into a separate folder and unpack it using the below command or changing the format to .zip
{code:java}
jar xf jira-core-language-pack-fr_FR-8.5.0.v20190920192957.jar
{code}

 * Look for this file 'issue-update-batch-mail_fr_FR.properties'
 * Edit the file using a text editor and replace line 37 as below (the correct translation)
{code:java}
vous avez \u00e9t\u00e9 mentionn\u00e9 dans ce ticket.
{code}
!image-2020-10-09-16-09-52-659.png|thumbnail!

 * Save the file
 * Using the terminal, navigate to the newly created folder
{code:java}
cd <path to dir>/jira-core-language-pack-fr_FR-8.5.0.v20190920192957
{code}

 * From inside the directory, run the following command
{code:java}
jar cf ../jira-core-language-pack-fr_FR-8.5.0.v20190920192957.jar * 
{code}

 * The JAR file will be created and upload it through the JIRA Administration > Manage Apps > Upload an App
fields.summary: French translation for batching email notifications (mentioned)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If you change Automation for Jira's language to French, several components such as actions, conditions, triggers, and branch components are left untranslated.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Press the *dot* (*.*) key twice and type *Automation rules* into the box that will appear.
# Click on the option that will appear.
# Click on the *Create rule* button.
# Scroll down to see the different triggers available.
# Select any of the triggers (easiest is the manual trigger) and click on *Save*.
# Click on *Add component*.
# Select *New condition*.
# Scroll down to see all conditions available.
# Click on *Cancel*.
# Click on *Add component*.
# Select *New action*.
# Scroll down to see all actions available.
# Click on *Cancel*.
# Click on *Add component*.
# Select *Branch rule / Related issues".
# Check all components available.

h3. Expected Results

All actions, conditions, triggers, and branch components are translated to French.

h3. Actual Results

The following components are not translated:
* Triggers:

** Issue link deleted
** Issue linked
** Service limit breached
** Sprint completed
** Sprint created
** Sprint started
** Version created
** Version released
** Version unreleased
** Version updated
** Work logged

* Conditions:

** Issue fields condition.
** If/Else block.

* Actions:

** Delete comment
** Delete issue links
** Log work
** Send Microsoft Teams message
** Send Stride message
** Create version
** Release version
** Unrelease version

* Branch components (under the *Type of related issues* field)

** Destination issue
** Issues fixed in version
** Issues fixed in sprint

h3. Workaround

 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Several triggers, actions, conditions and branch components are untranslated to French in Automation for Jira

fields.description:
In Swedish, there are several incorrect translations on the "Customers" pages in Jira Service Desk projects. Please see the attached screenshots.

1. The "View open" and "View closed" (intended to be short for "View open issues" and "View closed issues") actions in the customers table are translated as "Vy öppen" (= "View(n.) open(adj. sg.)") instead of "Visa öppna" (= "View(v.) open(adj. pl.)") and "Vy stängd" (same but closed(adj. sg.)) instead of "Visa stängda" (same but closed(adj. pl.))

2. The "Add customers" action on the "Customers" page is translated incorrectly with the infinitive "Lägga till kunder" (add(inf.) customers) instead of the imperative "Lägg till kunder" (add(imp.) customers)

3. The "Add customers" action on the Organisation page (go to "Customers" and click on an organisation in the table) has the same issue as #2. Not sure if the string is being re-used or if it's a repeat problem with the same string under a different key.

4. Is the same as 2 & 3.
fields.summary: Swedish: Incorrect translations on Jira Service Desk Customers and Organisations pages

fields.description:
In Confluence Cloud, you can see "X people like this" at the bottom of the page.
 These has extra kanjis in Japanese. The unit word "人" is duplicated.

!Screen Shot 2020-09-24 at 12.28.39.png|thumbnail!

For instance:

 * あなた および *他 80 人* 人のユーザーがいいね! しています
 * *82 人* 人のユーザーがいいね! しています

Suggested translation:

 * あなた および *他 80 人* のユーザーがいいね! しています
 * *82 人* のユーザーがいいね! しています
fields.summary: Regression: wrong translation for liked number of people

fields.description:
There are two issues with the circled content (see screenshot) on the Team profile page:

1.) "Stupsen Sie an" doesn't make sense in this context; it translates into "Go, poke..."

2.) "Person" is female in German (+die+ Person). Hence, the possessive pronoun "seine" is wrong. It should be "ihre".

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using Jira SD Automation to comment when a linked issue is moved, the Spanish commentary has the emoji (n) on it.  The emoji shortcut is a 'n' inside parenthesis and the phrase contains this shortcut.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to Project Settings > Automation.
 # Add Rule > 'Update when a linked issue changes'.
 # Click in 'Then' and Edit 'Add Comment'.
 # Check the option 'Include the linked issue's details'
 # Confirm and Save changes.
 # Link an issue to another.
 # Transition the linked issue.

h3. Expected Results

The full phrase without any Emojis.
h3. Actual Results

!image-2020-09-17-11-36-30-531.png|width=447,height=156!
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Automatic comment on linked issues contains an emoji in Spanish translation

fields.description: In Jira Settings > System > Global permissions, Russian translation for *View users* shows as Просмотр пользовтелей but the correct translation is Просмотр пользовАтелей.
fields.summary: Russian translation for View users is incorrect

fields.description:
The term *issue* is...
 # sometimes translated into *Vorgang* (as per this source: [https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1wgK69jqmpBr7wGMh0ZE8E93f70zX2nQVJ3lOnHOq24s/edit?usp=sharing]); and
 # sometimes used in *English* (e.g. Jascha hat Ihre Zuweisung zu einem Issue zurückgezogen).

*We should agree on and implement one standard!*

Moreover, when used in *English*, the term "Issue" currently has either a masculine or neutral article (based on the attached screenshot - "zu einem Issue").

Intuitively, I would ascribe the term *Issue* a feminine article (die) when used in German. This would change the sentence from the screenshot to "Shilpa Airi hat Ihre Zuweisung zu eine*r* Issue zurückgezogen."
fields.summary: The term issue is not consistently translated into German and uses the wrong genus when used in English

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The email you get when someone edits a page with the difference of the previous version has a mistake. And there is a translation missing for the following key:

Page update email has missing translation key for 'edit' (edit is still in English and should also be in Spanish)
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set language to Spanish
 # Edit Confluence Page that you're watching
 # Check the email coming in in Spanish

h3. Expected Results

1. It should be "nuevo" for singular as opposed to "nuevos" which is plural
2. "edit" is in english when it should be in spanish 
 can use "cambio" or "edición" to replace "edit"
h3. Actual Results

In english it says "There's 1 new edit on this page"
 Spanish says : "Hay 1 nuevos edit en tu página"
fields.summary: Confluence "edit" update email has error and missing translation in ES

fields.description:
screen: Project settings > Permissions > Issue permissions > Transition Issues
 EN: Transition Issues
 !IssuePermissions-ENG.png|width=220,height=137!

Jira in Japanese: トランジション課題
 !TransitionIssue-Japanese.png|width=195,height=210!

[CAC(Japanese)|https://ja.confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/managing-project-permissions-938847145.html]: 課題のトランジション
 !TransitionIssue-JAC-Japanese.png|width=196,height=138!

 

I think "Transition Issues" translates in Japanese "課題のトランジション" is more natural than "トランジション課題".
 "課題のトランジション" is already used in CAC, so Jira in Japanese should be fixed.

 

---

Related issue: [https://getsupport.atlassian.com/browse/JPNS-35875]
fields.summary: Unnatural translation in Transition Issues(Project settings > Permissions > Issue permissions > Transition Issues)

fields.description:
A customer has configured Language support under his JSD project to Italian. 

On his workflow, one of the translation is set as "Escalate". The *Property Key* is: jira.i18n.title, Property Value is: sd.workflow.escalate

When you select Italian as your preferred language, *Escalate* is being translated to "*Riassegna*" = "reassign" which is not the correct translation for this word. A closer word would be "Intensificare" as an example.
fields.summary: Property Value: sd.workflow.escalate translating incorrectly when language is Italian

fields.description:
Hi [~c383681f6b03],

Internal German speaking team member [~jzittel@atlassian.com] has flagged the current translation we have in Confluence Cloud for "Help us improve" is incorrect as "Help on te verbeteren". 

I've found the two affected strings in Smartling here:

 

1. [https://dashboard.smartling.com/app/projects/3c380ebe3/strings/?localeIds=de-DE&activeStringsFilter.presence=BOTH&hashcodes=f2c420f7b556d78493fc4e4b82519d9b]

2.[https://dashboard.smartling.com/app/projects/3c380ebe3/strings/?localeIds=de-DE&activeStringsFilter.presence=BOTH&hashcodes=c377441d7baf27c8242629302163c335] > This string is odd because I can see a vendor language manager logged in and submitted a translation of "Helfen Sie uns, besser zu werden" which was overwritten by the API (our team) for some reason. 

 

If you could have your German language owner please log in and correct these two strings, that would be great.

 

Many thanks,

Melanie
fields.summary: German translation error for "Help us improve"

fields.description:
The next-gen projects popularize agile project management.

"Epic" remains the last technical jargon term.
fields.summary: Translation of Epic into French

fields.description:
We are about to install Jira Software v 8.11.0 in production enviroment, but, since the provided Italian language pack has wrong translations, I had to revise all .properties files in the jar to have a proper translation of the contents.

Sometimes the problems concern the translation of single words:

 
||English||Current Italian Translation||Supposed to be||
|Issue|Ticket|Segnalazione/Problema*|
|Reporter|Reporter|Segnalante|
|Dashboard|Dashboard|Cruscotto|
|Assignee|Assignee|Assegnatario|
|Subtask|Subtask|Sottoattività|

 

*dipends on the context. The correct translation for a Jira Issue is "Seganlazione" but if "issue" refers to any trobule with the Jira instance, it should be translated as "Problema".

Sometimes the translation issues have to do the meaning of whole sentences (messages) that don't really make sense in Italian.

Every time a new Italian Language pack (especially for a new Jira Version) is released by Atlassian, I have to manually edit the content of the .properties files and re-pack the jar with a custom version to ensure having a propert Italian transaltions of all labels and messages in the production environment. I had to do this recently, after the language pack v 8.12 was released for Jira 8.11.0.

How can I contribute to the official Italian translation to avoid having to do the aforementioned time-consuming steps every time?
fields.summary: Jira Core Italian Language Pack has wrong translations

fields.description:
In Confluence is have detected two errors in the Dutch translation. 

 

1) Spatiebalk -> Space
 * In Confluence: Edit / + / Other macro's.
 * Choose "Create form Template" / "Maak op basis van Sjabloon".
 * Here the field title "Spacekey" is translated as "Spatiebalk" Which means as much as "Spacebar". Suggestion -> Pagina Key or Pagina sleutel.

2)  Uittreksel meerekenen -> Excerpt Include
 * In Confluence: Edit / + / Other macro's.
 * Choose the macro Excerpt Include / Uittreksel meerekenen
 * The name of the macro "Uittreksel meerekenen" means as much as "Adding up the Excerpt". Suggestion -> "Uittreksel invoegen"
fields.summary: Dutch translation errors in Confluence macro's

fields.description: We have an inconsistent translation for "Good" and "Very Good" in French which appears in Emails sent after a Jira Service Desk ticket is resolved as a survey on the service experience.
fields.summary: Inconsistent translation for "Good" and "Very Good" in French

It will be great if Bitbucket Cloud supports Chinese(Taiwan) language.
We have a user willing to contribute to the language project.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The translation of "uploaded" and "download" during page edits in Confluence is wrong.

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set language to Dutch
 # User 1 Edits a page and uploads an attachment.
 # User 2 edit the page and uploads another attachment.

h3. Expected Results

The pop-up message should say, user 1 uploaded a file:

"Iemand heeft XX minuten geleden een nieuwere versie van dit bestand geüpload"
h3. Actual Results

The pop-up message says, user 1 downloaded a file:
 "Iemand heeft XX minuten geleden een nieuwere versie van dit bestand gedownload"
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Translation error in Companion App from English to Dutch

fields.description:
In quite a few cases, the mouse-over texts have not been completely translated. This affects the keyboard shortcut hints that are in parantheses and contain the English word "type" in the German translation.

Some examples (might not be all of them) - the first example is actually already correct and it's what the suggestions are based on:
||Source||Target||Suggestion||
|{color:#00875a}Watch (type 'w'){color}|{color:#00875a}Beobachten (w){color}| |
|Save for later (type 'f')|Speichern für später (type 'f')|Speichern für später (f)|
|Edit (type 'e')|Bearbeiten (type 'e')|Bearbeiten (e)|
|Share this page with others (Type 's'OR 'k')|Diese Seite mit anderen teilen (Type 's'OR 'k')|Diese Seite mit anderen Teilen (s oder k)|
|​Open Notifications (type 'g' then 'n')|​Öffne Benachrichtigungen (type 'g' then 'n')|​​Öffne Benachrichtigungen (g dann n)|

 

As mentioned, these are just some example and to fix all of them, the translation package should be checked for occurrences of "type"
fields.summary: Translation error for mouse-over hints

When customer raises a request, an automated message will be sent to them. In this, the translation for "request" differs in Japanese(依頼, リクエスト). 
 !スクリーンショット 2020-08-05 12.18.58.png|thumbnail! 

Though this is a configurable setting, for better user experience, we should use the same translations for same source words.
fields.summary: Different translation for the same word

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When removing the Due Date field from the Epic Issue type in Next-gen projects, error received in German has translation bug

URL: [https://your_domain.atlassian.net/jira/software/projects/FNG/boards/1/roadmap|https://atl-arawat.atlassian.net/jira/software/projects/FNG/boards/1/roadmap]
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Change the language to German
 # Go to any Next-gen projects
 # Click on Project Settings
 # Click on Epic Issue Type
 # Remove the Due Date field from Epic
 # Save Changes 
 # Error with wrong translation appears

h3. Expected Results
{noformat}
It should be 'Datenfelder hinzufügen'. {noformat}
h3. Actual Results
{noformat}
Instead it is Datuenfelder hinzufügen'{noformat}
h3. Workaround

None

---

https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-74896?error=login_required&error_description=Login+required&state=85994d28-02eb-4617-b871-728b9328f896
fields.summary: German Translation Bug in the Error when removing Due Date field from Epic

Multiple times we had our clients complaining about this translation.

It is shown in customer portal's and issue view attachment fields.

!image-2020-08-03-17-24-47-321.png!

!image-2020-08-03-17-25-06-557.png!

 

You can't really use just "Обзор" there because it is noun but not verb.

It should be something more like "Перетащите файлы, вставьте снимки экрана или _нажмите для выбора вложений_"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Dutch translation wrong in page information for 'word' as 'woord'
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Change the user's preferred Language to 'Nederlands' (Dutch)
 # Open a Confluence Page
 # Click   !https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/files/704577869/704577870/2/1517274795952/ellipsis.png|width=22!  > *Page Information* on the top right corner.
 # Observe the '*Export As:*'
h3. Expected Results
It should be "Word" since it refers to the name of the MS Office program. 
h3. Actual Results
It wrongly translates to 'Woord'

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Dutch translation in page information for 'word' as 'woord'. It should be "Word" since it refers to the name of the MS Office program.

fields.description:
*Bug*

Every batch email notification begins with the following text:
{quote}Es gibt .
{quote}
Obviously there is missing some text between "Es gibt" and the full stop.

To reproduce activate batch email notifications and assign or comment a ticket. I'm using Jira 8.10.1.

*Suggested Fix*

This problem can be fixed by changing the file {{issue-update-batch-mail_de_DE}} of the Jira core language pack "jira-core-language-pack-de_DE".
 Change the key
 {{issue.update.batch.mail.header.summary.prefix}}
 as described in the fields below.

After this change the introduction is
{quote}Es gibt *1 Kommentar*.
{quote}
fields.summary: Introduction text of JIRA batch email notification is incomplete in german translation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
# In the Hungarian language pack (confluence-language-pack-hu_HU-7.6.0.rc1-20200630032408), there are some errors for the translation in the comment sections.
## The date is translated "type" / "típus" is put behind it:
## The placeholder has two additional unknown (not hungarian) character behind it
## After the link of the user the word "type" / "típus" is present
# Issue not seen in other language packs 

h3. Actual Results
# The date is translated "type" / "típus" is put behind it.
** File: {code:java}confluence-inline-comments_hu_HU.properties{code}
** Property: {code:java}inline.comments.date.friendly.formatted=''{0}'' t\u00edpus{code}
# The placeholder has two additional unknown (not hungarian) character behind it:
** File: {code:java}com\atlassian\confluence\plugins\quickcomment\i18n_hu_HU.properties{code}
** Property: {code:java}quick.comment.placeholder.message=\u00cdrj
hozz\u00e1sz\u00f3l\u00e1st\u00e2\u00a6{code}
# After the link of the user the word "type" / "típus" is present
** File: {code:java}com\atlassian\confluence\core\ConfluenceActionSupport_hu_HU.properties{code}
** Property: {code:java}comment.author.byline=''{0}'' t\u00edpus{code}

h3. Expected Results
# "tipus" should not be there.
# {code:java}quick.comment.placeholder.message=\u00cdrj
hozz\u00e1sz\u00f3l\u00e1st{code}
# "tipus" should not be there.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Check on the Hungarian language pack in Confluence 7.6.0 and later.

h3. Workaround
* None
fields.summary: Extra string in the Hungarian language pack translation

fields.description:
In Advanced roadmaps.

 
 * In the plan creation wizard (right screenshot), Story Points is translated as "Points d'éffort".
 * In the plan configuration, this is not translated and left to be "Story points".

 

This should be translated consistently (one or the other).
fields.summary: Inconsistent translation of Story Points in French in Advanced Roadmaps

fields.description:
!image-2020-07-13-16-10-39-985.png|width=267,height=264!

In Advanced Roadmaps, the Group by feature has a list of potential entities to group by.

One of each is group-by Release (or Versions)

 

This is currently translated as "Livrer" -> Meaning "To Deliver" and should by whichever is Jira's standard for Releases/Versions which is "Version" in french.
fields.summary: Advanced Roadmaps Group-by release feature wrongly translated in French

fields.description:
!image-2020-07-13-16-01-03-681.png|width=321,height=317!

 

The roll-up feature in Advanced Roadmaps applies to issue hierarchy, where a parent would show values based on those of its children. Some examples:
 * Estimations would be a Sum of its own + its children
 * Start dates would be its own OR, if none provided, the earliest start date of its children
 * Same logic for End Dates
 * Teams would be a full list of its children's Team (and its own if any)
 * Same logic for Releases

With that in mind, the French translation of Roll-up is currently "Repeter" which means "Repeated". This doesn't quite make sense in that context.

 

I do not have an obvious suggestion to make but my best guess would to use some direct translation of Aggregate (agréger) instead.
fields.summary: Misleading French translation of 'Roll-up' in Advanced Roadmaps

fields.description:
As part of the Advanced Roadmaps Plan creation wizard, it is asked to
{quote}Clear the checkboxes of any issues you'd like to exclude.
{quote}
Which is currently translated in French as:
{quote}Cochez les cases en regard de ceux à exclure.
{quote}
Which roughly translates to "Check the boxes with regards to those to exclude". I am largely unable to understand this sentence, but also the only way I can see it work would actually have it mean the opposite of what it should.

 

!image-2020-07-13-15-55-39-247.png!
fields.summary: Advanced Roadmap Plan Creation Wizard - Unclear instruction in French

fields.description:
Suggested translations:
 * *どちらもこれに作業しました* →
 ** *ここで作業しました*
 ** *一緒に作業しました*
 ** or just simply: *作業しました*
 * *にここにコメントしました* → *でコメントしました*

Example
 [https://hello.atlassian.net/jira/people/557057:d90de407-9bc4-4cd6-a4c4-16ba6ab2787b]

It'd be better to say: "limpar" (clean), "esconder" (hide).

fields.description:
The following translation errors occur in Dutch in Advanced Roadmaps for Jira Cloud/Server:
* Sidebar:
** I'd suggest translating "Scheduling" as "Planning" instead of "Plannen" to avoid confusion with the Dutch word for "Plans". 
** I'd suggest translating "Source data" as "Brongegevens" instead of "Brondata" since the former is the more commonly used Dutch term.
* {{Scheduling}} section:
** "Start date" is translated as "Begindatum" but "... don't have start and end dates" is translated as "... geen start- en einddatums hebben". To be consistent, use "... geen begin- en einddatums hebben".
** "Sequential" is incorrectly translated as "Opvolgend". It should be "Opeenvolgend".
** The verb modality of every sentence is different. To be consistent, make the following corrections:
*** Translate "Estimate issues in" as "Schat issue in" instead of "Issues schatten in"
*** Translate "Configure how to ..." as "Configureer hoe ..." instead of "Configureren hoe"

Corresponding JPO ticket: https://jdog.jira-dev.com/browse/JPO-14460
fields.summary: Dutch translation errors in the plan settings of ARJ

fields.description:
The following translation errors occur in Dutch in Advanced Roadmaps for Jira Cloud/Server:
* The "Start date" field is not translated. It should be "Begindatum".
* The "Target start" field is translated as "Doelstart" while the "Target end" field is translated as "Beoogd einde". This is inconsistent. To avoid confusion, I'd suggest translating "Target start" as "Beoogde begindatum" and "Target end" as "Beoogde einddatum".
* The "Fit" button is incorrectly translated as "Passen". It should be "Passend".

Corresponding JPO ticket: https://jdog.jira-dev.com/browse/JPO-14459
fields.summary: Dutch translation errors in the Roadmaps tab of ARJ

fields.description:
Even though Advanced Roadmaps is a product name, it is translated (to "geavanceerde roadmaps") in most _but not all_ places in Dutch.

This occurs in at least the following places of Advanced Roadmaps for Jira Cloud/Server:
 * In the {{Plans}} dropdown menu when there are no plans
 * In title _but not the description_ of the welcome dialog
 * In the {{Permissions}} section of a plan's settings

Corresponding JPO ticket: [https://jdog.jira-dev.com/browse/JPO-14458]
fields.summary: Advanced Roadmaps translated in Dutch even though it's a product name

fields.description:
The word "create" is incorrectly translated to "maken" in Advanced Roadmaps for Jira Cloud/Server. It should be "aanmaken" or "creëren". I'd opt for the former since the "Create" button in Jira has already been translated to "Aanmaken".

This occurs in at least the following places:
* In the {{Plans}} dropdown menu: "Create plan" should be "Plan aanmaken" instead of "Plan maken"
* In the {{Roadmap}} tab: "Create issue" should be "Issue aanmaken" instead of "Issue maken"
* In the {{Teams}} tab: "Create team" should be "Team aanmaken" instead of "Team maken"
* In the {{Releases}} tab: "Create release" should be "Release aanmaken" instead of "Release maken"

Corresponding JPO ticket: https://jdog.jira-dev.com/browse/JPO-14450
fields.summary: The word create is incorrectly translated in Dutch in ARJ

fields.description:
The word "plan(s)" is incorrectly translated to "abonnement(en)" in Advanced Roadmaps for Jira Cloud/Server. It should be plan(nen).

* This occurs in at least the following places:
* In the \{{Plans}} dropdown menu when no plans exist
* In the sidebar of a plan's settings: 
** "Plan settings" should be "Planinstellingen" instead of "Abonnementsinstellingen"
** "Back to plan" should be "Terug naar plan" instead of "Terug naar abonnement"
* In the \{{Scheduling}} section of a plan's settings
* In the \{{Issue sources}} section of a plan's settings
* In the \{{Permissions}} section of a plan's settings
* In the \{{Scenarios}} section of a plan's settings

Corresponding JPO ticket: https://jdog.jira-dev.com/browse/JPO-14446
fields.summary: The word plan(s) is incorrectly translated in Dutch in ARJ

fields.description:
There is an incorrect string on the Portuguese - Brazil translation when you are adding flags to a card that is on a board.

h3. Steps to Reproduce: 

# Create a board.
# Add a few issues to an active sprint.
# Select the *Active Sprints* view.
# Right-click on one of the cards.
# Locate the *Add flag* option.

h3. Expected behavior

The *Add flag* option is translated to *Adicionar bandeira* ou *Adicionar Flag*.

h3. Actual behavior

The *Add flag* option is translated to *Flag Adicionada*, as displayed on the screenshot below:

 !Screen Shot 2020-07-01 at 18.55.44.png|thumbnail!
